Questions.QuestionString: The warning message appears amber on the ECAM DOOR/OXY page (Level 3)
Answers: In low pressure conditions only.
in case of overpressure
In high pressure condition.

Questions.QuestionString: Test operation of the crew oxygen system by (Level 1)
Answers: Push the reset test slider.
Using MCDU.
Check system pressure on ECAM Door/Oxy Page.

Questions.QuestionString: How many ways to drop the oxygen masks: (Level 1)
On ground, if the chemical oxygen units has been used you must: (Level 1)
Answers: Replaced the unit only.
Reset and refill the unit.
Replaced the unit and all masks restowed.

Questions.QuestionString: The expended generator is show by (Level 1)
Answers: A green stripe indicator.
A black indicator.
A thermal yellow indicator.

Questions.QuestionString: In the passenger oxygen system, a chemical oxygen generator, once activated, delivers Oxygen for: (Level 3)
Answers: 30 minutes, if only one mask is in use
5 minutes, if all masks are used
13 minutes, regardless of the number of the masks used

Questions.QuestionString: An oxygen generator starts to make oxygen when: (Level 2)
Answers: The panel is opened.
The lanyard is pulled.
The MAN OVRD pushbutton on the passenger oxygen control panel is operated.

Questions.QuestionString: How is the passenger chemical generator activated? (Level 2)
Answers: By pushing the MASK MAN ON pushbutton.
As soon as the ALTITUDE PRESSURE SWITCH is closed.
By a release pin which is connected via a lanyard to the oxygen mask

Questions.QuestionString: What is indicated when the white "SYS ON" light (Panel 21 VU) on the passenger oxygen system is illuminated? (Level 3)
Answers: The chemical oxygen generators are activated
The time delay relay is fully energized
The passenger oxygen system is electrically operated

Questions.QuestionString: Masks are supplied with undiluted Oxygen on demand if the cabin altitude rises above 14.000 ft, passenger oxygen masks will drop out? (Level 2)
Answers: Only by actuation of a switch on the captain panel
Automatically by the cabin pressure and/or cabin attendant action
Automatically by the cabin pressure and/or flight crew action

Questions.QuestionString: How do the time delay relays control the Pax. system automatic operation (Level 2)
Answers: They cut off electrical supply after 30 seconds
They supply the system for 3 seconds
They supply the system after 30 seconds

Questions.QuestionString: What happen when the 100% position is selected on crew oxygen masks? (Level 3)
Answers: The user breathes filtered cabin air
The user breathes pure oxygen at a permanent positive pressure.
The user breathes pure oxygen

Questions.QuestionString: What is the "reset TEST SLIDER" of crew oxygen system used for? (Level 2)
Answers: To control mask oxygen inlet.
To prevent oxygen inlet to mask.
To control oxygen supply during tests and mask operation.

Questions.QuestionString: The passenger and cabin attendant oxygen system is supplied by: (Level 2)
Answers: The chemical oxygen generator units.
A high pressure oxygen cylinder.
The high pressure portable cylinder.

Questions.QuestionString: The smoke hood system provides breathing means and eye protection for: (Level 2)
Answers: The crew members only.
The crew members and cabin attendants.
The crew members and passenger.

Questions.QuestionString: The oxygen system on the aircraft consists of: (Level 3)
Answers: A fixed high pressure cylinder and a high pressure portable cylinder.
A high pressure portable cylinder and a chemical generator.
A fixed high pressure cylinder, a high pressure portable cylinder and a chemical generator.

Questions.QuestionString: Normally overboard discharge is indicated by: (Level 1)
Answers: A warning on the oxygen control panel 21VU.
The direct reading pressure gauge on the oxygen cylinder.
A yellow indicator.

Questions.QuestionString: The oxygen masks are automatically dropped when (Level 1)
Answers: The cabin altitude is higher than 14000 feet.
The cabin altitude is 8000 feet.
Positive pressure presented.

Questions.QuestionString: The crew oxygen is supplied by: (Level 2)
Answers: A portable bottle.
A high pressure oxygen cylinder.
A chemical unit.

Questions.QuestionString: Without electric the cylinder pressure can be checked by (Level 2)
Answers: A direct reading pressure gage.
An overboard green discharge indicator.
ECAM indication

Questions.QuestionString: With The manual ON/OFF valve is closed the cylinder pressure: (Level 2)
Answers: Can be checked by the pressure gage.
Can not be checked
Can be checked if electric are available

Questions.QuestionString: Overpressure protection of the crew oxygen is achieved by (Level 2)
Answers: A frangible disk type and a pressure relief valve.
An overpressure valve.
An overboard green discharge indicator

Questions.QuestionString: The chemical generator units provide oxygen for: (Level 1)
Answers: Approximately 13 or 15 minutes.
At least 30 minutes.
Passenger only.

Questions.QuestionString: The oxygen units are installed in the passenger compartment as follows: (Level 3)
Answers: Above the passenger seats.
Above the passenger seats, in the lavatories.
Above the passenger seats, in the lavatories and at the cabin attendant stations.

Questions.QuestionString: The oxygen masks may be dropped: (Level 1)
Answers: Automatically only
Manually only.
Automatically or manually

Questions.QuestionString: In case of failure of the container door opening system. A release tool allows: (Level 2)
Answers: Bypass opening of the door.
Mechanical opening of the door.
Electrical trigger.

Questions.QuestionString: Pressing the MASK MAN ON pushbutton The passenger oxygen masks: (Level 1)
Answers: presented at some case.
presented at any time.
Presented and oxygen supplied.

Questions.QuestionString: The time delay relays control the Pax oxygen system automatic operation by (Level 2)
Answers: Cut off electrical supply after 30 seconds.
Supply the system for 3 seconds.
Supply the system after 30 seconds.

Questions.QuestionString: The chemical oxygen generator supplies a flow of (Level 3)
Answers: Low pressure oxygen.
High pressure oxygen for a minimum time of 13 or 15 minutes.
A mixture of cabin air and oxygen for passengers.

Questions.QuestionString: On ground, used chemical oxygen units (Level 2)
Answers: Are reset by momentarily pressing the TMR RESET pushbutton on the maintenance panel.
Must be replaced.
Must be recharged.

Questions.QuestionString: The passenger and cabin attendant oxygen system can be supplied by: (Level 2)
Answers: The chemical oxygen generator units.
A high pressure oxygen cylinder.
A portable oxygen bottle and chemical oxygen generator units.

Questions.QuestionString: The warning message “REGUL LO PR” appears amber on the ECAM DOOR/OXY page when: (Level 3)
Answers: The oxygen pressure drops below the minimum operating pressure of 50 plus or minus 5 PSI.
in case of overpressure
In high pressure condition.

Questions.QuestionString: An amber half frame appears at oxygen pressure on the ECAM page (Level 3)
Answers: if the crew oxygen pressure is less than 1450 psig.
if the crew oxygen pressure is less than 1500 psig.
if the crew oxygen pressure is less than 1850 psig.

Questions.QuestionString: Which is NOT true? (Level 3)
Answers: The user get pure oxygen when Normal/100% selector is in the 100% position at any aircraft altitude higher than 36000 ft.
The user get pure oxygen when Normal/100% selector is in the Normal position at any aircraft altitude higher than 36000 ft.
The user get mixure of cabin air and oxygen when Normal/100% selector is in the Normal position at any aircraft altitude higher than 36000 ft.

Questions.QuestionString: How you can change “OXY” indication on the DOOR/OXY page from amber to green when you do Operational test of the Crew Oxygen Distribution: (Level 3)
Answers: Push the MASK MAN ON pushbutton switch on the panel 21VU.
Push the OXYGEN/CREW SUPPLY pushbutton switch on the panel 21VU.
Push the PRESS TO TEST AND RESET pushbutton switch on the oxygen mask stowage boxes.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the PASSENGER SYS ON light mean (Level 1)
Answers: The passenger oxygen system has been actived by flight crew.
The signal to release the oxygen mask doors has been sent.
The passenger oxygen generator has been used.

Questions.QuestionString: The discharge indicator which is a green blow-out disc will blow out at a pressure of: (Level 3)
Answers: 40 to 100 psi
500 to 1000 psi

Questions.QuestionString: REGUL LO PR Message shown on ECAM page if pressure decreases to: (Level 3)
When the full-face quick-donning mask is removed, the crew oxygen system is: (Level 3)
Answers: Automatically switched on
Supplied oxygen to the mask
Armed.

Questions.QuestionString: The flag OXY ON will go out of sight when the supply valve: (Level 2)
Answers: Opened.
Closed.
Closed and reset.

Questions.QuestionString: The Normal/100% selector in the Normal position. Above 34778 ft, the crew oxygen system supply: (Level 2)
Answers: 100 % oxygen,
80 % oxygen & 20 % cabin air,
75 % oxygen & 25 % cabin air.

Questions.QuestionString: How to know the PAX chemical oxygen generator is used or not more usable: (Level 3)
Answers: An indicator on the housing will change color from yellow to black,
An indicator on the housing will change color from green to red,
Check on the overhead panel 21VU.

Questions.QuestionString: When you Do the operational test of the passenger-oxygen system, If you hold the MASK MAN ON pushbutton switch for more than 30 sec: (Level 3)
Answers: The emergency announcements stop,
The ON indicator light on the TMR RESET pushbutton switch comes on,
The FAULT indication light in the TMR RESET pushbutton switch comes on.

Questions.QuestionString: The Cabin Portable Oxygen Cylinders are equipped with protective device: (Level 2)
Answers: A high-pressure relief valve with a rupture disc
A low-pressure relief valve
Both A & B.

Questions.QuestionString: The aircraft oxygen system has: (A,B1) (Level 1)
Answers: A separate crew and pax system
For the crew a H.P. and a L.P. system
2 (each) crew cylinders

Questions.QuestionString: When the passenger oxygen masks have been deployed automatically: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: To reset the system provisions are available at the oxygen generators
The crew will automatically receive oxygen at the same time
The timer relay is reset by its pushbutton on panel 50 VU

Questions.QuestionString: Can the crew oxygen cylinder pressure be checked when there is no electrical power? (A,B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: Yes
No
Never

Questions.QuestionString: What indicates an overboard discharge? (A,B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: A warning on the oxygen control panel 21VU.
The direct reading pressure gauge on the oxygen cylinder.
A yellow indicator.

Questions.QuestionString: The TMR reset fault light comes on if? (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: The reset operation is not yet completed.
The reset operation has failed
The time delay relays has failed during the automatic operation.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of the hood absorption system of the smoke hood? (B1) (Level 1)
Answers: To add oxygen to the expired gas.
To trap the carbon dioxide contain in the expired gas
To allow the expired gas to flow out the hood

Questions.QuestionString: A manual ON/OFF valve of flight crew Oxygen Cylinder is used: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: During the replacement of the cylinder and to isolate the cylinder if there is a leak in the oxygen system.
Allow flight crew to adjust the air flow into the masks.
To reduce the air pressure from high pressure to low pressure

Questions.QuestionString: A direct-reading pressure gage of flight crew Oxygen Cylinder: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: Provide direct indication of the cylinder high-pressure to flight crew during flight.
Independent of the open or closed position of the manual ON/OFF valve.
Ground engineer must check oxygen pressure through direct-reading pressure gage before dispatch the aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString: Low-Pressure Supply Valve of flight crew Oxygen system is: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: A manual ON/OFF valve and can control from avionic compartment.
A solenoid valve and can control from the control panel in the cockpit.
A manual ON/OFF valve and can control from the control panel in the cockpit.

Questions.QuestionString: A warning signal "REGUL LO PR" appears on the ECAM when: (B1,B2) (Level 1)
Answers: Pressure of the distribution manifold decreases to 50 ± 5 psi.
Pressure of Crew Oxygen Cylinder decreases to 1000 ± 5 psi
Pressure of Crew Oxygen Cylinder decreases to 1450 ± 5 psi
